alert.note: Alert for Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Northern Arctic Coast; Northwest Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 02 at 3:08PM AKST until January 05 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occuring. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Northwest Arctic Coast, Northern Arctic Coast and Central Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Blowing snow will cause whiteout conditions. Large snow drifts will form. Wind chills to 50 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East winds will are causing blowing snow and low visibility. The strongest winds and lowest visibility are expected this afternoon into Thursday.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Northern Arctic Coast; Northwest Arctic Coast
